Package ex4

Interface GUI_Shape_Collection

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    Shape_Collection
    public interface GUI_Shape_Collection
    This interface represents a collection of gui_shapes with the following capabilities: 1. add a gui_shape at a given location. 2. get a gui_shape at a given location. 3. remove a single or all gui_shapes. 4. sort the gui_shapes according to shape Comparator 5. computes the bounding box containing all the shapes as a minimal 2D rectangle. Ex4: you should NOT change this interface!
    Author:
    boaz.benmoshe

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void add​(GUI_Shape s)
      This method adds the gui_element s to this collection in the last position.
      void addAt​(GUI_Shape s, int i)
      This method adds the gui_element s to this collection in the i'th position.
      GUI_Shape_Collection copy()
      This method constructs a deep copy of this collection.
      GUI_Shape get​(int i)
      This method return a reference to the i'th element in the collection.
      Rect2D getBoundingBox()
      This methods returns the minimal bounding box containing all the shapes in this collection.
      void load​(java.lang.String file)
      This method restore a gui_shape collection from text file (as saved be the save method).
      void removeAll()
      This method simple removes all the elements from this collection.
      GUI_Shape removeElementAt​(int i)
      This method remove (and return) the gui_shape at the i'th location.
      void save​(java.lang.String file_name)
      This method saves this gui_shape collection to a text file.
      int size()
      return the size of the collection (if empty return 0).
      void sort​(java.util.Comparator<GUI_Shape> comp)
      This method sorts this gui_shape collection according to the comp Comparator - in increasing order.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        GUI_Shape get​(int i)
        This method return a reference to the i'th element in the collection.
        Parameters:
        i - - the index of the element
        Returns:
        a reference (NOT a copy) for the i'th element in the collection.

      • size

        int size()
        return the size of the collection (if empty return 0).
        Returns:

      • removeElementAt

        GUI_Shape removeElementAt​(int i)
        This method remove (and return) the gui_shape at the i'th location. After removing the size of this collection decreases (by 1) and the order (of the elements) remains the same - just with out the removed element.
        Parameters:
        i - - the index of the element to be removed.
        Returns:
        the gui_shape which was removed

      • add

        void add​(GUI_Shape s)
        This method adds the gui_element s to this collection in the last position. Note: the method adds s "as is" (NOT a new copy of s).
        Parameters:
        s - - the gui_shape

      • addAt

        void addAt​(GUI_Shape s,
           int i)
        This method adds the gui_element s to this collection in the i'th position. Note: the method adds s "as is" (NOT a new copy of s).
        Parameters:
        s - - the gui_shape
        i - - the location (index) in which s should be added

      • copy

        GUI_Shape_Collection copy()
        This method constructs a deep copy of this collection. Note: the two collections are equal - yet they have no shared memory.
        Returns:

      • sort

        void sort​(java.util.Comparator<GUI_Shape> comp)
        This method sorts this gui_shape collection according to the comp Comparator - in increasing order.
        Parameters:
        comp - a linear order over gui_sahpes as defined in java.util.Comparator

      • removeAll

        void removeAll()
        This method simple removes all the elements from this collection.

      • save

        void save​(java.lang.String file_name)
        This method saves this gui_shape collection to a text file.
        Parameters:
        file_name - - the file name in which this collection will be saved.

      • load

        void load​(java.lang.String file)
        This method restore a gui_shape collection from text file (as saved be the save method). Note this method changes the this collection.
        Parameters:
        file - - the name of the text file to create a gui shape file from.

      • getBoundingBox

        Rect2D getBoundingBox()
        This methods returns the minimal bounding box containing all the shapes in this collection.
        Returns:
